title: Date Methods
intro: `K` returns the current, local date and time and `Ð`Ð`` is the `Date` constructor, which can accept a Unix timetsamp or date string as a single argument or 2 or more integer arguments for the year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds and millseconds, respectively.

Methods `a-d` & `f-j` below can take up to 2 numeric arguments. The first argument defaults to `0` and returns the value described by the method's description; if `2` is passed instead then the same value is returned after first converting `D` to universal time (UTC). Passing a value of `1` sets the value in the method's description to the value of the second argument, which defaults to `0`, and a value of `3` does the same after, again, converting `D` to UTC. Setting any part of the date modifies the original `D` and returns `D` as a Unix timestamp.

Note that months and weekdays are 0-indexed in JavaScript and, by extension, Japt. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date) for more details on working with `Date` objects in JavaScript.

a().description: Returns or sets the milliseconds of `D`.

b().description: Returns or sets the seconds of `D`.

c().description: Returns or sets the minutes of `D`.

d().description: Returns or sets the hours of `D`.

e().description: Returns the index of the day of the week of `D`.

f().description: Returns or sets the date of `D`.

g().description: Returns or sets the month of `D`.

h().description: Returns or sets the years since `1900` of `D`. Note that this method has been deprecated in JavaScript.

i().description: Returns or sets the year of `D`.

j().description: Returns or sets the number of milliseconds in `D` since `January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC`.

k().description: Returns the time zone difference in minutes between the local time and UTC.

n(n).description: Returns the result of subtracting `D`, as a Unix timestamp, from `n`.

s(n=0).description:
Returns `D` converted to:
• a [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toString) if `n=0`,
• a [date string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toDateString) if `n=1`,
• a [time string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toTimeString) if `n=2`,
• an [ISO string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toISOString) if `n=3`,
• a [GMT string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toGMTString) if `n=4`,
• a [UTC string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toUTCString) if `n=5`,
• a [locale string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleString) if `n=6`,
• a [locale date string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleDateString) if `n=7`, or,
• a [locale time string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleTimeString) if `n=8`.
